choices.A: LAG-3 on switches on FS448D-A and FS448D-B may be connected to a single 802.3ad trunk on another device.
choices.C: port13 and port14 on FS448D-A should be connected to port13 and port14 on FS448D-B.
choices.B: LAG-1 and LAG-2 should be connected to a 4-port single 802.3ad trunk on another device.
choices.D: LAG-1 and LAG-2 should be connected to a single 4-port 802.3ad interface on the FortiGate-A.

choices.C: An outbound policy from the Azure FortiGate-VM virtual appliance.
choices.D: A FortiGate-VM virtual appliance deployed in Azure.
choices.B: An inbound policy from the Azure FortiGate-VM virtual appliance.

questions.question_text:
A customer wants to integrate their on-premise FortiGate with their Azure infrastructure.
Which two components must be in place to configure the Azure Fabric connector? (Choose two.)

You cannot ping the FortiGate default gateway 10.10.10.1 from the FortiGate CLI. The FortiGate interface facing the default gateway is wan1 and its IP address is
10.10.10.254/24. During the initial troubleshooting tests, you confirm that you can ping other IP addresses in the 10.10.10.0/24 subnet from the FortiGate CLI without packets lost.
Which two CLI commands will help you to troubleshoot this problem? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Correct: CD

To check arp list, sniffer to host and arp, "arp" its possible use in sniffer

Example:

FGT # diagnose sniffer packet port1 "host 221.142.61.32 and arp" 4
interfaces=[port1]
filters=[host 221.142.61.32 and arp]
17.766400 port1 -- arp who-has 221.142.61.32 tell 221.142.61.32

No A, because its in same segment and using source address, device info nic, mmm only to know physical mac wan1
I would say C,D --- sniffer with arp flag is perfectly possible

Selected Answer: AC
Answer is A and C, B is wrong because that command give you conuters and nothing else

https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/hardware-acceleration/90160/diagnose-hardware-deviceinfo-nic-interface-name-number-of-packets-dropped-by-an-interface

 D is incorrect because you need to use the following if need to see arp packets

Match ARP packets only:

 

# diagnose sniffer packet wan1 "ether proto 0x0806"

https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Troubleshooting-Tip-Using-the-FortiOS-built-in-packet-sniffer/ta-p/194222
i'm thinking of B, to check hardware first (even though other 10.1.1.0/24 are reachable) and C, to check the ARP list
yes A is incorrect, as it specifies saddr.

C and D are most likely the right ones.
A does not makes sense, using debug flow is usually to check outgoing policy or Natting behavior. in this case, we are still on the local network

choices.D: diag sniffer packet wan1 'arp and host 10.10.10.1'
choices.A: diagnose debug flow filter saddr 10.10.10.1 diagnose debug flow trace start 10

choices.B: Install both Supervisor and Collector on each remote site.
choices.D: Disable real-time log upload on the remote sites.
choices.C: Install local Collectors on each remote site.
choices.A: Enable SD-WAN FEC (Forward Error Correction) on the FortiGate at the remote site.

questions.question_text:
An organization has one central site and three remote sites. A FortiSIEM has been installed on the central site and now all devices across the remote sites must be centrally monitored by the FortiSIEM at the central site.
Which action will reduce the WAN usage by the monitoring system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct as per https://help.fortinet.com/fsiem/5-2-1/Online-Help/HTML5_Help/Setting_Collectors_Enterprise.htm#:~:text=A%20Collector%20enables%20FortiSIEM%20to,Internet%20and%20behind%20a%20firewall.

questions.question_text:
A customer is looking for a way to remove javascripts, macros and hyperlinks from documents traversing the network without affecting the integrity of the content.
You propose to use the Content disarm and reconstruction (CDR) feature of the FortiGate.
Which two considerations are valid to implement CDR in this scenario? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The inspection mode of the FortiGate is not relevant for CDR to operate.
choices.D: Files processed by CDR can have the original copy quarantined on the FortiGate.
choices.B: CDR is supported on HTTPS, SMTPS, and IMAPS if deep inspection is enabled.
choices.C: CDR can only be performed on Microsoft Office Document and PDF files.

discussion.content:
Correct: CD:

Incorrect A: CDR works only in proxy mode 
Incorrect B not works to https, smtps and imaps

Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct as per previously mentioned link and this link https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/cookbook/788313/content-disarm-and-reconstruction-for-antivirus
